perturbation.original_text: "Licensee Site" means the website operated by Licensee on or through which the Licensed Content is displayed.
perturbation.changed_text: "Licensee Platform" means the website operated by Licensee on or through which the Licensed Content is displayed.
perturbation.explanation: Replaced 'Licensee Site' with 'Licensee Platform.' The contract then uses 'Licensee Site' and 'Licensee Platform' interchangeably. This creates confusion about the scope of the agreement and what exactly is considered the licensed platform.

perturbation.original_text:
3.  License Grants.
3.1 Content License.	Subject	to	Licensee’s	on­going	compliance	with	Section 3.2 and all other terms and conditions of this Agreement, Licensor
grants to Licensee an exclusive (save for rights reserved to Licensor hereunder), non-transferable (except as provided in Section 11.7) and non-
sublicensable license, during the License Term, to reproduce, perform, display, transmit and distribute the Licensed Content on the Licensee Siteand
Related Media intended solely for use by End Usersin the Territory within the scope set forth in Schedule 1 (License Scope), which is attached hereto
and incorporated herein by this reference. The foregoing includes the right to permit End Users to access the Licensed Content solely for their own
end use and not for redistribution and otherwise subject to Terms of Use that comply with Section 4.3. Licensee is not granted any right to, and shall
not, permit any other use of the Licensed Content by End Users, or any use of the Licensed Content by any other Person (including Licensee's
Affiliates).
perturbation.changed_text:
3.  License Grants.
3.1 Content License.	Subject	to	Licensee’s	on­going	compliance	with	Section 3.2 and all other terms and conditions of this Agreement, Licensor
grants to Licensee an exclusive (save for rights reserved to Licensor hereunder), non-transferable (except as provided in Section 11.7) and non-
sublicensable license, during the License Term, to reproduce, perform, display, transmit and distribute the Licensed Content on the Licensee Platform and
Related Media intended solely for use by End Usersin the Territory within the scope set forth in Schedule 1 (License Scope), which is attached hereto
and incorporated herein by this reference. The foregoing includes the right to permit End Users to access the Licensed Content solely for their own
end use and not for redistribution and otherwise subject to Terms of Use that comply with Section 4.3. Licensee is not granted any right to, and shall
not, permit any other use of the Licensed Content by End Users, or any use of the Licensed Content by any other Person (including Licensee's
Affiliates).
perturbation.explanation: Modified the 'Licensee Site' to 'Licensee Platform' and now it is not consistent with the original definition in the Definitions, and other section where it uses 'Licensee Site'. This is the core of the contradiction.

perturbation.original_text:
4.1 Content Display. Throughout the Term, Licensee shall provide the Licensed Content on the Licensee Site and Related Media solely to the
extent of and within the scope of the license granted in this Agreement and otherwise in accordance with the following:
(a) Licensee shall present the Licensed Content solely in accordance with the specifications and restrictions set forth in Schedule 4.
(b) Licensee shall update Licensed Content on the Licensee Site and Related Media promptly upon receipt of such updates from the
Licensor.
(c) Licensee shall present each Content Item solely in its entirety (without any addition, modification or deletion).
(d) Licensee shall remove the Licensed Content from the Licensee Site and Related Media immediately upon the expiration or earlier
termination of the License Term for such Content Item.
perturbation.changed_text:
4.1 Content Display. Throughout the Term, Licensee shall provide the Licensed Content on the Licensee Site and Related Media solely to the
extent of and within the scope of the license granted in this Agreement and otherwise in accordance with the following:
(a) Licensee shall present the Licensed Content solely in accordance with the specifications and restrictions set forth in Schedule 4.
(b) Licensee shall update Licensed Content on the Licensee Platform and Related Media promptly upon receipt of such updates from the
Licensor.
(c) Licensee shall present each Content Item solely in its entirety (without any addition, modification or deletion).
(d) Licensee shall remove the Licensed Content from the Licensee Platform and Related Media immediately upon the expiration or earlier
termination of the License Term for such Content Item.
perturbation.explanation: Changed 'Licensee Site' to 'Licensee Platform' in subsections b and d, but not a and c. Now there is an inconsistency in the same section that may lead to legal challenge.
